comment: DONT TAKE HIM! His accent is too heavy to understand especially because he doesnt seem to know how to use technology&post what he wants to say in a D2L announcement instead of having to call a class meeting&saying something no one understands. Requirements for progress reports is ridiculous&dont make sense. Unwilling to help or doesnt understand.
awful professor, never want to help, too mean, not friendly heavy accent Don't take this professor

I DO NOT recommend his class if you wish to learn. I really wonder how he became a professor because he is not able to TEACH AT ALL! You do not have to email him when you are struggling with a question because he will NEVER response back to you.

You may not be able to gain as much knowledge as one would hope due to his accent and simplicity but the class sure was great for an easy A. Tests are mostly based off the questions assigned for optional homework.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Very difficult to understand and he's not very approachable. I think it's a cultural difference. He intends to be friendly but comes off rude sometimes. Tests were book tests that were a bit arbitrary and I don't feel I learned that much from his lectures or slides. He gives so many extra credit points though, so it's totally possible to get an A.

Do not take a class with this professor (especially networking)!. It is already a difficult subject which he made more difficult with his heavy accent, an insane project that even the tutoring lab was unable to help with, and closed notes/book tests that required in-class or Lockdown browser with webcam. He does not care about you as a student.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Don't take this class online. You cannot learn from his lectures due to his accent. Why do they let teachers which such terrible language skills teach!

Dr. Kim isn't bad by any measure.  He gives practice problems, and the tests are basically taken directly from them.  Grades hard. Gives Full, Half, or No credit, but his criteria for Half credit seems overly specific.  Very thick accent.  Doesn't detract from his lectures, but if you have never dealt with a Korean accent before, be prepared .
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: As long as you do your work, you will get an A. 1) Do all your assignments, 2) Do all extra credit assignments, 3) Don't skip too often, 4) Just do Average on Exams. Follow these 4 rules, and you will finish this course with a grade of 100 A+. If you need more time on your assignments, he will always extend them for you if you ask. You will learn.

His assignments vary wildly in difficulty without much rhyme or reason. He disrespected students from other sections in front of our class (why?).  The textbook we used had prebaked code to use for assignments which made everything really easy.  Course really does not cover much material. As long as you can pick up C++ quickly you should be fine.

Kim is a great professor. He is always available during his office hours and he offers 3 optional extra credit assignments, that can boost you up a whole letter grade if you can manage to complete all 3. The only catch is that each extra credit assignment increases in difficulty significantly so most students were only able to complete 1 or 2.
